thread.title: Queen distributes bubur lambuk at mosque | The Star
thread.title_full: Queen distributes bubur lambuk at mosque | The Star

author: NA
title: Queen distributes bubur lambuk at mosque | The Star
text:
KUALA LUMPUR: Her Majesty Raja Zarith Sofiah, Queen of Malaysia, has graced a bubur lambuk distribution ceremony at Masjid Jamek Kampong Baru here.
Her Majesty arrived at the mosque yesterday morning where she had the opportunity to observe the preparation of the savoury rice porridge and mingle with those involved in the event.
Raja Zarith Sofiah then distributed bubur lambuk to 20 representatives of mosques from seven zones in the Federal Territory, as well as non-governmental organisations.
As early as 7am, mosque staff, together with personnel from the Federal Territory Islamic Religious Department (Jawi) and volunteers, joined hands to cook a total of 50 pots of bubur lambuk.
About 12,500 packets of bubur lambuk are expected to be distributed to (kariah members) congregants and the local community, aiming to highlight the mosque’s role as a place of worship and a centre for nurturing goodwill during this holy month, reported Bernama.
The programme, organised by Jawi in collaboration with Istana Negara, Masjid Jamek Kampong Baru and Persatuan Anak Melayu Johor, was also attended by Jawi director Datuk Mohd Ajib Ismail, Federal Territory and Selangor Persatuan Anak Melayu Johor president Datuk Seri Dr Syed Hussein Al-Habshee and Masjid Jamek Kampong Bharu chairman Datuk Mohd Khay Ibrahim.
